IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS A RANGE OF PROJECTS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT DEMONSTRATE INNOVATION AND FORWARD THINKING IN THEIR APPROACH TO PROBLEM SOLVING AND IMPROVING ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL CONDITIONS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE BLACKSTONE CHARITABLE FOUNDATION (THE "FOUNDATION") SERVES AS THE PRIMARY VEHICLE FOR CHARITABLE GIVING ON BEHALF OF THE SENIOR MANAGING DIRECTORS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE BLACKSTONE GROUP L.P. ("BLACKSTONE"). THE FOUNDATION'S PHILANTHROPY EXTENDS TO SUPPORTING COMMUNITIES IN NEED, IN GEOGRAPHIC AREAS WHERE BLACKSTONE WORKS AND LIVES, WHICH CAN BENEFIT FROM BLACKSTONE'S INTELLECTURAL AND FINANCIAL CAPITAL. THE FOUNDATION DIRECTS SUPPORT TO A RANGE OF PROJECTS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT DEMONSTRATE INNOVATION AND FORWARD THINKING IN THEIR APPROACH TO PROBLEM SOLVING AND IMPROVING ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL CONDITIONS. On April 30, 2010, the Foundation launched "The Blackstone Entrepreneurship Initiative" (the "Initiative"), a five-year, $50,000,000 conditional initiative to create connected networks, or "ecosystems", of master coaches in regions across the nation and around the world. Through these connecting ecosystems, the Foundation's goal is to build an elite global network of master coaches a
IRS990.Description: Blackstone LaunchPad is a national model for fostering entrepreneurship through higher education. Based on a successful program at the University of Miami, it encourages entrepreneurial thinking and activity among undergraduate and graduate students as well as faculty and alumni for the purpose of incubating a new generation of entrepreneurs who will contribute to the economic revitalization of distressed regions. The Foundation has awarded $5,400,000 in conditional funding for Blackstone LaunchPad of which $2,422,000 has been paid through June 30, 2013. Blackstone Entrepreneurs Network is an initiative to strengthen existing entrepreneurial ecosystems in struggling areas by building a network of master entrepreneurs and connecting them with a pipeline of potential high growth ventures. The Foundation has awarded $3,630,000 in conditional funding for Blackstone Entrepreneurs Network of which $2,453,000 has been paid through June 30, 2013. Blackstone Accelerates Growth spurs economic growth and is designed to help historically resource-based economies transition to innovation economies. Rural economies in the United States must overcome unique challenges, including geographically dispersed population centers and lower levels of innovation and R&D investments. Blackstone Accelerates Growth promotes entrepreneurship by coordinating a critical network of entrepreneurial services to high-potential companies in newly created Innovation Hubs. The Foundation has awarded $4,600,000 in conditional funding for Blackstone Accelerates Growth of which $1,694,736 has been paid through June 30, 2013. [4] The Blackstone Organizational Grants program makes targeted grants to entrepreneurial organizations that spread the ideals of entrepreneurship and benefit local communities. In coordination with its regional efforts to spur entrepreneurship around the country and the world, the Foundation is creating a national and global network in which the participating organizations can share best practices, methodologies, and contacts, and are connected with Blackstone's intellectual capital and resources. Through June 30, 2013, the Foundation awarded $1,000,000 in conditional funding in Organizational Grants and in 2013 paid $499,500 of this award. Through June 30, 2013, the Foundation has awarded $14,630,000 toward the $50,000,000 Initiative.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART X, QUESTION 2
Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Explanation: The Foundation follows the provisions of the Financial Accounting Standards Board's Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Topic 740-10-05 relating to accounting and reporting for uncertainty in income taxes. Since the Foundation has always recorded the potential tax liability for excise tax, and due to its general tax-exempt status, ASC Topic 740-10-05 has not had, and is not expected to have, a material effect on its financial statements. The Foundation is no longer subject to examination by federal or state tax authorities for fiscal years prior to 2010.

Form990ScheduleFPartV.Identifier: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS OUTSIDE THE US
Form990ScheduleFPartV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleFPartV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATiON RESEARCHES ALL FOREIGN GRANTS TO INSURE THAT FUNDS ARE SENT TO ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE FOUNDTION'S GUIDELINES. ALL GRANT RECIPIENTS UNDERSTAND THAT REPORTS MUST BE FURNISHED UPON REQUEST.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.ReturnReference: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON THE RECOMMENDATIONS AND INPUT OF ITS BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FOUNDATION GENERALLY ONLY APPROVES GRants TO PRESELECTED CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS AND DOES NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED REQUESTS FOR FUNDS. THE ORGANIZATION, AT ITS DISCRETION, MAY REQUEST ADDITIONAL DOCUMENTATION FOR COMPLIANCE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART 1, LINE 4 AND PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPRISED OF EMPLOYEES OF THE BLACKSTONE GROUP, LP. BLACKSTONE GROUP MANAGEMENT LLC, WHICH SERVES AS THE GENERAL PARTNER OF THE BLACKSTONE GROUP LP, IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE FOUNDATION. AS THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE COMPENSATED AS EMPLOYEES OF A RELATED ORGANIZATION, THEY ARE NOT DEEMED TO BE INDEPENDENT VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING BOARD. THE BLACKSTONE GROUP, LP THROUGH ITS WHOLLY OWNED ENTITY BLACKSTONE ADMINSTARATIVE SERVICES PARTNERSHIP LLC ("SERVICES"), PROVIDES THE FOUNDATION WITH OFFICE SPACE AND GRANT AND INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT SERVICES WITHOUT CHARGE. IN ADDITION, SERVICES PROVIDES AN INTEREST-FREE LOAN TO THE FOUNDATION IN ORDER TO FUND A PORTION OF ITS CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES, PAYROLL AND BENEFITS FOR THE FOUNDATION STAFF (SERVICES ACTS AS COMMON PAYMASTER), AND OTHER RELATED ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS. THE MATURITY DATE OF THE OUTSTANDING BALANCE IS DECEMBER 31, 2015.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MANAGEMENT AND OUTSIDE COUNSEL FOR THE FOUNDATION REVIEW THE DRAFT FORM 990. UPON COMPLETION OF THE REVIEWS, THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVE THE APPROVED DRAFT PRIOR TO ITS ELECTRONIC FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AND SIGN AN ANNUAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF COMPLIANCE WITH THE FOUNDATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND REPORT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION OF THE FOUNDATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS BEEN RATIFIED BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS USING DATA FOR COMPARABLE POSITIONS FROM PUBLIC SOURCES, INCLUDING SURVEYS COMPILED FROM THE FORMS 990 OF LIKE SIZED ORGANIZATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COPIES OF THE FOUNDATION'S FORM 990 AND ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: EXTENSION OF TIME TO FILE FOR AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: APPLICATIONS FOR EXTENSIONS OF TIME TO FILE AN EXEMPT ORGANIZATION RETURN WERE ELECTRONICALLY FILED.

Form990ScheduleRPartVII.Explanation: SEE SCHEDULE O FOR A DESCRIPTION OF THE FOUNDATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS.
